channel.title: Click of death?
channel.description: I think I got the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Click_of_death]click of death[/url] yesterday when I was booting my PC. During the boot up I could clearly hear something clicking in the PC. So I restarted the PC just to see if I got it again, and I did. I just decided to see if I still would get it tomorrow but I didn't. So, will this problem return later, or was this just some random problem?

item.title: Click of death?
item.dc:creator: @Invoke1 Invoke
item.description:
@Invoke1 wrote:

This could be a problem, I recommend taking it in to get it checked out or replacing your drive.

Read full topic

item.title: Click of death?
item.dc:creator: @Tulitikku Tulitikku
item.description:
@Tulitikku wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:10, topic:290473”][quote author=Tulitikku link=topic=384018.msg2881547#msg2881547 date=1248379323]

Does the hard drive and motherboard support S.M.A.R.T. and have it turned on? If so don’t worry about it until SMART tells you your drive is about to die.
[/quote]Just installed smartmontools on my Linux, my HDD passed the test. Never heard of S.M.A.R.T before, but I’ll be using it now on.
I’m still a bit worried though, since hardware problems usually don’t just “fix automatically”.

I’m not sure if that’s the same thing or not, SMART is a feature that must be supported on the hard drive and the BIOS, and takes place before any operating systems come into play.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S.M.A.R.T.[/quote]It should be, I was using a guide from the Wikipedia external links at the bottom of the article.
http://prefetch.net/articles/diskdrives.smart.html

Read full topic

item.title: Click of death?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Tulitikku, post:4, topic:290473”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=384018.msg2881496#msg2881496 date=1248377680]
Does the hard drive and motherboard support S.M.A.R.T. and have it turned on? If so don’t worry about it until SMART tells you your drive is about to die.
[/quote]Just installed smartmontools on my Linux, my HDD passed the test. Never heard of S.M.A.R.T before, but I’ll be using it now on.
I’m still a bit worried though, since hardware problems usually don’t just “fix automatically”.[/quote]

I’m not sure if that’s the same thing or not, SMART is a feature that must be supported on the hard drive and the BIOS, and takes place before any operating systems come into play.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S.M.A.R.T.

Read full topic

Simple Problem?!: Maybe a cable is leaning against one of your fans?

item.description:
@Tulitikku wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:7, topic:290473”]the click of death is a zip drive phenomena :/[/quote]It can happen on hard-drives as well.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vbq8vfs1wYY The sound was somewhat similar to that in the video.

Read full topic

item.title: Click of death?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

I sometimes hear a clicking noise from my hard drive as well, usually while installing things/booting up… “Rarely, noise can be generated by power supply cables or other components close to the signal cable.” hopefully it’s that since my ps cables are close to the signal cable, but just in case I’m going to put all my important data on externals.

Read full topic

I think I got the click of death yesterday when I was booting my PC. During the boot up I could clearly hear something clicking in the PC. So I restarted the PC just to see if I got it again, and I did. I just decided to see if I still would get it tomorrow but I didn’t.
